Class GamePanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • frame.GamePanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class GamePanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    GamePanel accomplishes two tasks. It does the processing of the game, and the rendering.

    GamePanel uses the interaction between GameMouse and what it has stored to provide the game experience to the user. It also contains the GamePanel.Button class.

    Changes: The class now supports all aspects of combat, victory conditions, and all menu screens (plus splash art).

    Total Time Spent: 10 hour(s).

    Version:
    2.0.0.0
    Author:
    Lev Raizman
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  GamePanel.Button
      Button is the recreation of a JButton made to fit the needs of GamePanel.
      private class  GamePanel.MuteButton
      MuteButton is a special GamePanel.Button that is instantiated once in GamePanel, which allows the user to turn music on and off.

    • Field Detail

      • MAX_HELP_SCREENS

        private final int MAX_HELP_SCREENS
        Amount of help screens there are.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • gameState

        private int gameState
        Which screen the game is currently in.

        The screens are:

        0 - Main Menu

        1 - Adventure Game

        2 - Help

        3 - High Scores

        4 - Exit Screen

        5 - Removed

        6 - Regular Battle

        7 - Boss Battle

        8 - Game Over

        9 - Regular Message Screen

        10 - End Game Message Screen

        11 - Won Game

        12 - Exit

      • screenState

        private int screenState
        Required to track position on help screens.
